verbose_text: Interestingly, unlike in rodents, the recent human CALERIE-II trial, which evaluated the effect of 15% reduction in energy intake over 2 years, shows no decrease in serum circulating IGF-1 concentration but rather increased serum IGFBP-1 and decreased IGF-1 : IGFBP-1 ratio levels; this suggests an overall reduction in IGF-1 bioactivity in humans post-calorie restriction.
evidence: CALERIE-II trial, which evaluated the effect of 15% reduction in energy intake over 2 years, shows no decrease in serum-circulating IGF-1 concentration but rather increased serum IGFBP-1
